laboratory_examinations.findings: White-cell count was 5800 per cubic millimeter (reference range, 4500 to 11,000). 73% neutrophils (reference range, 40 to 70), 14% lymphocytes (reference range, 22 to 44), 6% monocytes (reference range, 4 to 11), and 7% eosinophils (reference range, 0 to 8).
Blood level of C-reactive protein was 9.7 mg per liter (reference range, <8.0, negative for inflammation).
Blood level of ACE was 55 U per liter (reference range, 8 to 53).
Hepatitis B virus surface antigen negative; hepatitis B virus surface antibodies positive.
Normal sinus rhythm, with a borderline early-repolarization abnormality and T-wave inversions in leads V1 and V2.
Multiple rounded, hypoechoic areas in the spleen, not enlarged, with no evidence of cholelithiasis or cholecystitis.

laboratory_examinations.procedure_name: CT Scans of the Abdomen and Pelvis
laboratory_examinations.findings: Numerous ill-defined, hypoattenuating lesions in the spleen; a hypoattenuating lesion in the liver, slightly increased in size from a study 8 years earlier.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: CT scan at follow-up 2 days after discharge showed mediastinal lymphadenopathy and bilateral hilar lymphadenopathy.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Resolution of opacities in the left upper lobe and persistent mild hilar lymphadenopathy.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: One year after initial presentation showed resolution of opacities.
